* Duke is a program that helps users keep track of their tasks
* @param filePath string for path-to-file to read/write list of tasks from/to
* @param message exception message to be printed for users
* class for tasks with a start and end time
* @param from        start time of event as a String
* @param to          end time of event as a String
public Event(String description, String from, String to) throws MissingDescriptionException {
* @return string with type, completion status, task description, start time of
*         task, and end time of task
return TASK_TYPE + super.toString() + " (from: " + from + " to:" + to + ")";
* returns string representation of event to be saved into the text file
* @return string representation of event to be saved into text file
return TASK_TYPE + "//" + completionStatus + "//" + description + "//" + from + "//" + to;
* Exception thrown for missing descriptions for tasks
super("OOPS!!! The description of a task cannot be empty.\n");
return "OOPS!!! The description of a task cannot be empty.\n";
* deals with understanding the instructions given to Duke
private static Ui ui = new Ui();
* Interprets the user input and executes the corresponding actions
* @param command input given by the user
* @param tasks   the tasklist to be changed according to the user input
public static void parse(String command, TaskList tasks) throws DukeException {
ui.printMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:\n" + tasks.toString());
System.out.println("Please give the index of the task you wish to mark!");
System.out.println("Please give the index of the task you wish to unmark!");
System.out.println("Please give the index of the task you wish to delete!");
* deals with loading and saving tasks to/from the tasklist in Duke
* @param filePath path to the file for read from/ write to
* obtains the lists of tasks from the text file and copies it into an arraylist
* @throws DukeException error reading tasks from the file
Task event = new Event(description, from, to);
throw new DukeException("Unknown task type found in storage file");
* writes the tasks from the current Duke program into the text file

* @throws DukeException error writing tasks into the text file

* marks a task in the arraylist as completed
* @param index index of the task to mark as completed
public void markTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + tasks.get(index - 1).toString());

* unmarks a task in arraylist to not done
* @param index index of the task to unmark
public void unmarkTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + tasks.get(index - 1).toString());
System.out.println("There is no such task in the list!");
